description: The host dashboard displays the configuration details and resources usage metrics of a selected host.

panels.content: ###### The host dashboard displays the configuration details and resources usage metrics of a selected host.

panels.description: The data center and cluster of the host. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT  
    CASE     
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date IS NULL  	    
            THEN datacenter_name 	
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date IS NOT NULL  	     
            THEN datacenter_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')' 
    END AS datacenter_name,
    CASE
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date IS NULL
            THEN cluster_name
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date IS NOT NULL
            THEN cluster_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')' 
    END AS cluster_name,
    fqdn_or_ip,
    v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.create_date,
    CASE
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NULL
            THEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.update_date
        ELSE NULL
    END AS update_date,
    CASE
        WHEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date IS NOT NULL
            THEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date
        ELSE NULL
    END AS delete_date
FROM
    v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
    INNER JOIN
    v4_4_configuration_history_clusters
        ON
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.cluster_id =
                v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.cluster_id
                AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
                            WHERE host_id = ('$host_id')
                        )
                AND v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_clusters
                            GROUP BY cluster_id
                        )
            )
    INNER JOIN v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters
        ON
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_clusters.datacenter_id =
                v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.datacenter_id
                AND v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_configuration_history_datacenters
                            GROUP BY datacenter_id
                        )
            )

panels.description: The latest configuration details of the host.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    host_os,
    hardware_manufacturer,
    hardware_product_name,
    hardware_serial_number
FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
WHERE 
    host_id = ('$host_id')
    AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
        IN     
            (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts a
                GROUP BY a.host_id
            )

panels.description: The status of the host. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    CASE
        WHEN host_status = -1
            THEN 'Unknown Status'
        WHEN host_status = 1
            THEN 'Up'
        WHEN host_status = 2
            THEN 'Maintenance'
        WHEN host_status = 3
            THEN 'Problematic'
        ELSE NULL
    END
FROM 
    v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples 
WHERE
    host_id = ('$host_id')
    AND history_id
        IN
            (
                SELECT MAX (history_id)
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                GROUP BY host_id
            )
GROUP BY host_status

panels.title: Status

panels.description: The number of running virtual machines on the host. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT active_vms
FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
WHERE 
    history_id
        IN 
            (
                SELECT MAX (history_id)
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                GROUP BY host_id
            )
    AND host_id = ('$host_id')

panels.title: Number of Running VMs

panels.description: The number of CPU cores of the host. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    number_of_cores
FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
WHERE 
    host_id = ('$host_id')
    AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
        IN     
            (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts a
                GROUP BY a.host_id
            )

panels.title: CPU Cores

panels.description: The memory size of the host. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( memory_size_mb, 0.00 ) AS float ) :: numeric / 1024, 1 ) AS host_memsize
FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
WHERE 
    host_id = ('$host_id')
    AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.history_id 
        IN     
            (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts a
                GROUP BY a.host_id
            )

panels.title: Memory Size

panels.description: The total disks size of running virtual machines on the host. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT SUM (vm_disk_size_gb)
FROM
    (
        SELECT
            vm_name,
            ROUND ( COALESCE ( cpu_per_socket, 0 ) * COALESCE ( number_of_sockets, 0 ), 0 ) AS vm_cpucores,
            ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( memory_size_mb, 0.00 ) AS float ) :: numeric / 1024, 1 ) AS vm_memsize,
            SUM (COALESCE ( vm_disk_size_mb, 0.00 )) :: numeric / 1024 AS vm_disk_size_gb,
            SUM (COALESCE ( vm_disk_actual_size_mb, 0.00 )) :: numeric / 1024 AS vm_disk_actual_size_gb
        FROM 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_vms
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices
                ON
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices.vm_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id
                        AND v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices.history_id 
                            IN 
                                ( 
                                    SELECT MAX (history_id) 
                                    FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices 
                                    WHERE type = 'disk' 
                                    GROUP BY device_id
                                )
                    )
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_disks
                ON
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices.device_id
                    )
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                ON
                    (
                        v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.vm_disk_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_disks.vm_disk_id
                        AND v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.history_id
                            IN
                                (
                                    SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                                    GROUP BY vm_disk_id
                                )
                    )
        WHERE 
            -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user
            v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT vm_id
                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                        WHERE 
                            currently_running_on_host = ('$host_id')
                            AND vm_status = 1
                            AND history_id
                                IN
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                        GROUP BY vm_id
                                    )   
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
            AND v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_vms a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_id
                    )
        GROUP BY
            vm_name, 
            cpu_per_socket, 
            number_of_sockets, 
            memory_size_mb
    ) AS sub_query

panels.title: Running VMs Total Disk Size

panels.description: Running virtual machines total CPU cores vs. host CPU cores. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR48 - This query returns the
-- average number of CPU Cores, Physical Memory and disk usage
-- for the vms running on the selected host.

SELECT
    CASE
        WHEN SUM ( total_hosts_num_of_cpus ) = 0
            THEN NULL
        ELSE ( SUM ( cpu_cores_running ) / SUM ( total_hosts_num_of_cpus ) )
    END AS "cpu_usage_ratio"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            SUM 
                ( 
                    COALESCE ( v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts.number_of_cores, 0 )
                ) AS total_hosts_num_of_cpus,
            cpu_memory_allocation.cpu_cores_running
        FROM  
            v4_4_latest_configuration_datacenters
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_datacenters.datacenter_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_clusters.datacenter_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id
                        AND host_id = ('$host_id')
                    )
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_tags_relations
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_4_latest_tags_relations.entity_id
                        AND v4_4_latest_tags_relations.entity_type = 3
                    )
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_tags_details
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_tags_relations.parent_id =
                        v4_4_latest_tags_details.tag_id
                    )
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            (
                SELECT
                    a.cluster_id,
                    SUM 
                        (
                            CASE
                                WHEN samples.vm_status = 1
                                    THEN COALESCE ( v4_4_configuration_history_vms.cpu_per_socket, 0 ) * COALESCE ( v4_4_configuration_history_vms.number_of_sockets, 0 )
                                ELSE 0
                            END
                        ) AS cpu_cores_running
                FROM
                    v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS samples
                    INNER JOIN 
                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                                samples.vm_configuration_version
                                AND currently_running_on_host = ('$host_id')
                            )
                    INNER JOIN 
                    v4_4_latest_configuration_vms a
                        ON 
                            (
                                a.vm_id =
                                samples.vm_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    samples.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( history_id )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS b
                                GROUP BY vm_id
                            )
                GROUP BY a.cluster_id
            ) AS cpu_memory_allocation
                ON 
                    (
                        cpu_memory_allocation.cluster_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id
                    )
        GROUP BY cpu_memory_allocation.cpu_cores_running
    ) AS dc

panels.title: Running VMs CPU Overcommit (BR48)

panels.description: The uptime percentage of the host, over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR6 - This query returns the average
-- uptime percent for the selected host

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT
    (
        -- Here we sum the total uptime
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN statistics.host_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( statistics.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        /
        -- Here we sum the total time
        SUM 
            (
                statistics.minutes_in_status
            )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_mins_percent
FROM 
    (
        SELECT host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status, history_datetime
        FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
    ) AS statistics
    INNER JOIN 
    v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
        ON 
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                statistics.host_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
    v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id = ('$host_id')
    -- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back
    AND $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
    AND statistics.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND statistics.history_datetime < $__timeTo()

-- DR6 - This query returns the average
-- uptime percent for the selected host

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT
    (
        -- Here we sum the total uptime
        SUM 
            (
                CASE
                    WHEN statistics.host_status = 1
                        THEN COALESCE ( statistics.minutes_in_status, 0 )
                    ELSE 0
                END
            ) 
        /
        -- Here we sum the total time
        SUM 
            (
                statistics.minutes_in_status
            )
    ) * 100 AS uptime_mins_percent
FROM 
    (
            SELECT host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status, history_datetime
            FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
        UNION
            SELECT host_id, host_status, minutes_in_status, history_datetime
            FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
            WHERE
                history_datetime <
                    (
                        SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                        FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                    )
    ) AS statistics
    INNER JOIN 
    v4_4_configuration_history_hosts
        ON 
            (
                v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id =
                statistics.host_id
            )
WHERE
    -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
    v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.host_id = ('$host_id')
    -- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
    AND $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
    -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
    AND statistics.history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
    AND statistics.history_datetime < $__timeTo()

panels.title: Uptime (DR6)

panels.description: The CPU usage percentage of the host. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR12 - This query returns the average
-- resources that are used ( cpu and memory )
-- for the selected host

SELECT
    cpu_usage_percent_avg AS average_cpu_used
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            AVG ( cpu_usage_percent ) AS cpu_usage_percent_avg
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT host_id, host_status, cpu_usage_percent
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                WHERE 
                    history_id
                        IN
                            (
                                SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                                GROUP BY host_id
                            )
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                        statistics.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we get only active host
            statistics.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id = ('$host_id')
    ) AS average_cpu_percent

panels.title: CPU Usage (DR12)

panels.description: The Memory usage percentage of the host. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
-- DR12 - This query returns the average
-- resources that are used ( cpu and memory )
-- for the selected host

SELECT
    memory_usage_percent_avg AS average_memory_used
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            AVG ( memory_usage_percent ) AS memory_usage_percent_avg
        FROM 
            (
                SELECT host_id, host_status, memory_usage_percent
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                WHERE 
                    history_id
                        IN
                            (
                                SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                                GROUP BY host_id
                            )
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                        statistics.host_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we get only active host
            statistics.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id = ('$host_id')
    ) AS average_memory_percent

panels.title: Memory Usage (DR12)

panels.description: Running virtual machines total used disks size vs. Running virtual machines total disks size. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT 
    CASE 
        WHEN SUM (vm_disk_size_gb) = 0
            THEN NULL
        WHEN SUM (vm_disk_size_gb) != 0
            THEN SUM (vm_disk_actual_size_gb) / SUM (vm_disk_size_gb)
    END 
FROM
    (
        SELECT
            vm_name,
            ROUND ( COALESCE ( cpu_per_socket, 0 ) * COALESCE ( number_of_sockets, 0 ), 0 ) AS vm_cpucores,
            ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( memory_size_mb, 0.00 ) AS float ) :: numeric / 1024, 1 ) AS vm_memsize,
            SUM (COALESCE ( vm_disk_size_mb, 0.00 )) :: numeric / 1024 AS vm_disk_size_gb,
            SUM (COALESCE ( vm_disk_actual_size_mb, 0.00 )) :: numeric / 1024 AS vm_disk_actual_size_gb
        FROM 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_vms
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices
                ON
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices.vm_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id
                        AND v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices.history_id 
                            IN 
                                ( 
                                    SELECT MAX (history_id) 
                                    FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices 
                                    WHERE type = 'disk' 
                                    GROUP BY device_id
                                )
                    )
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_disks
                ON
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices.device_id
                    )
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                ON
                    (
                        v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.vm_disk_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_disks.vm_disk_id
                        AND v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.history_id
                            IN
                                (
                                    SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                                    GROUP BY vm_disk_id
                                )
                    )
        WHERE 
            -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user
            v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT vm_id
                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                        WHERE 
                            currently_running_on_host = ('$host_id')
                            AND vm_status = 1
                            AND history_id
                                IN
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                        FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                        GROUP BY vm_id
                                    )   
                    )
            -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
            AND v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_vms a
                        GROUP BY a.vm_id
                    )
        GROUP BY 
            vm_name, 
            cpu_per_socket, 
            number_of_sockets, 
            memory_size_mb
    ) AS sub_query

panels.title: Disk Usage

panels.description: Running virtual machines total memory size vs. host memory size. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR48 - This query returns the
-- average number of CPU Cores, Physical Memory and disk usage
-- for the vms running on the selected host.

SELECT
    CASE
        WHEN SUM ( total_hosts_mem ) = 0
            THEN NULL
        ELSE ( SUM ( mem_running ) / SUM ( total_hosts_mem ) )
    END AS "memory_usage_ratio"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT
            ROUND ( CAST ( SUM ( COALESCE ( v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts.memory_size_mb, 0.00 ) ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric / 1024, 2 ) AS total_hosts_mem,
            cpu_memory_allocation.mem_running
        FROM  
            v4_4_latest_configuration_datacenters
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_clusters
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_datacenters.datacenter_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_clusters.datacenter_id
                    )
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts.cluster_id
                        AND host_id = ('$host_id')
                    )
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_tags_relations
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts.host_id =
                        v4_4_latest_tags_relations.entity_id
                        AND v4_4_latest_tags_relations.entity_type = 3
                    )
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            v4_4_latest_tags_details
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_latest_tags_relations.parent_id =
                        v4_4_latest_tags_details.tag_id
                    )
            LEFT OUTER JOIN 
            (
                SELECT
                    a.cluster_id,
                    ROUND ( CAST ( SUM 
                        (
                            CASE
                                WHEN samples.vm_status = 1
                                    THEN COALESCE ( v4_4_configuration_history_vms.memory_size_mb, 0.00 )
                                ELSE 0.00
                            END 
                        ) AS FLOAT ) :: numeric / 1024, 2 ) AS mem_running
                FROM
                    v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS samples
                    INNER JOIN 
                    v4_4_configuration_history_vms
                        ON 
                            (
                                v4_4_configuration_history_vms.history_id =
                                samples.vm_configuration_version
                                AND currently_running_on_host = ('$host_id')
                            )
                    INNER JOIN 
                    v4_4_latest_configuration_vms a
                        ON 
                            (
                                a.vm_id =
                                samples.vm_id
                            )
                WHERE
                    samples.history_id 
                        IN 
                            (
                                SELECT MAX ( history_id )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples AS b
                                GROUP BY vm_id
                            )
                GROUP BY a.cluster_id
            ) AS cpu_memory_allocation
                ON 
                    (
                        cpu_memory_allocation.cluster_id =
                        v4_4_latest_configuration_clusters.cluster_id
                    )
        GROUP BY cpu_memory_allocation.mem_running
    ) AS dc

panels.title: Running VMs Memory Overcommit (BR48)

panels.description: The virtual machines running on the host, and the size of their resources. In the latest configuration.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT
    vm_name,
    ROUND ( COALESCE ( cpu_per_socket, 0 ) * COALESCE ( number_of_sockets, 0 ), 0 ) AS vm_cpucores,
    ROUND ( CAST ( COALESCE ( memory_size_mb, 0.00 ) AS float ) :: numeric / 1024, 1 ) AS vm_memsize,
    SUM (COALESCE ( vm_disk_size_mb, 0.00 )) :: numeric / 1024 AS vm_disk_size_gb,
    SUM (COALESCE ( vm_disk_actual_size_mb, 0.00 )) :: numeric / 1024 AS vm_disk_actual_size_gb
FROM 
    v4_4_latest_configuration_vms
    LEFT OUTER JOIN 
    v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices
        ON
            (
                v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices.vm_id =
                v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id
                AND v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices.history_id 
                    IN 
                        ( 
                            SELECT MAX (history_id) 
                            FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices 
                            WHERE type = 'disk' 
                            GROUP BY device_id
                        )
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_disks
        ON
            (
                v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_disks.vm_disk_id =
                v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_devices.device_id
            )
    LEFT OUTER JOIN v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
        ON
            (
                v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.vm_disk_id =
                v4_4_latest_configuration_vms_disks.vm_disk_id
                AND v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples.history_id
                    IN
                        (
                            SELECT MAX (history_id)
                            FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_disks_resources_usage_samples
                            GROUP BY vm_disk_id
                        )
            )
WHERE 
    -- Here we filter by the virtual machine/s chosen by the user
    v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.vm_id 
        IN 
            (
                SELECT vm_id
                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                WHERE 
                    currently_running_on_host = ('$host_id')
                    AND vm_status = 1
                    AND history_id
                        IN
                            (
                                SELECT MAX (history_id)
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_vms_resources_usage_samples
                                GROUP BY vm_id
                            )   
            )
    -- Here we get the latest vm configurations
    AND v4_4_latest_configuration_vms.history_id 
        IN 
            (
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_vms a
                GROUP BY a.vm_id
            )
GROUP BY 
    vm_name, 
    cpu_per_socket, 
    number_of_sockets, 
    memory_size_mb

panels.title: Running VM Resources

panels.description: The latest host interfaces configuration details.

targets.rawSql:
SELECT DISTINCT
    CASE          
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN host_interface_name 	 	
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN host_interface_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS host_interface_name,
    CASE
        WHEN host_interface_type = 0
            THEN 'rt18139_pv'
        WHEN host_interface_type = 1
            THEN 'rt18139'
        WHEN host_interface_type = 2
            THEN 'e1000'
        WHEN host_interface_type = 3
            THEN 'pv'
        ELSE NULL
    END AS host_interface_type,
    mac_address,
    logical_network_name,
    ip_address,
    create_date,
    update_date
FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
WHERE 
    host_id = ('$host_id')
    AND history_id
        IN
            (
                SELECT MAX (history_id)
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                GROUP BY host_id, host_interface_name
            )

panels.title: Host Interface Inventory

panels.description: Average CPU usage and peaks of the host, over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2A - This query returns the host average
-- CPU usage and peaks over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- using the samples and hourly tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage",
    CPU_Peak AS "CPU Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- Host Max and Average Memory Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_cpu_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Peak
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, cpu_usage_percent AS max_cpu_usage, host_status, host_id 
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS statistics
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active host only
            statistics.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND statistics.host_id = ('$host_id')
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    sub_query.time, 
    CPU_Usage, 
    CPU_Peak
ORDER BY sub_query.time

-- BR2A - This query returns the host average
-- CPU usage and peaks over time.

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    CPU_Usage AS "CPU Usage",
    CPU_Peak AS "CPU Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- Host Max and Average Memory Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( cpu_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_cpu_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS CPU_Peak
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_cpu_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, cpu_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_cpu_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS statistics
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active host only
            statistics.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND statistics.host_id = ('$host_id')
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    sub_query.time, 
    CPU_Usage, 
    CPU_Peak
ORDER BY sub_query.time

panels.title: Average and Peak CPU Usage (over time) (BR2A)

panels.description: Average memory usage and peaks of the host, over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2A - This query returns the host average
-- memory usage and peaks over time.

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- using the samples and hourly tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Memory Usage",
    MEM_Peak AS "Memory Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- Host Max and Average Memory Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_memory_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Peak
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, memory_usage_percent AS max_memory_usage, host_status, host_id 
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS statistics
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active host only
            statistics.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND statistics.host_id = ('$host_id')
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    sub_query.time, 
    MEM_Usage, 
    MEM_Peak
ORDER BY sub_query.time

-- BR2A - This query returns the host average
-- memory usage and peaks over time.


-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    $__time(sub_query.time),
    MEM_Usage AS "Memory Usage",
    MEM_Peak AS "Memory Peak"
FROM 
    (
        -- Host Max and Average Memory Usage Peaks
        SELECT
            history_datetime AS time,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( memory_usage_percent, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Usage,
            SUM ( COALESCE ( max_memory_usage, 0 ) * COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) /
            SUM ( COALESCE ( minutes_in_status, 0 ) ) AS MEM_Peak
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_memory_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, memory_usage_percent, minutes_in_status, max_memory_usage, host_status, host_id 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS statistics
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by active host only
            statistics.host_status = 1
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            AND statistics.host_id = ('$host_id')
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
        GROUP BY history_datetime
    ) AS sub_query
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    sub_query.time, 
    MEM_Usage, 
    MEM_Peak
ORDER BY sub_query.time

panels.title: Average and Peak Memory Usage (over time) (BR2A)

panels.description: Average transmit and receive rates of the host interfaces, over the selected period.

targets.rawSql:
-- BR2A - This query returns the
-- Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates, over time

-- This query (A) displays recent data from the last hours, 
-- and for each minute, using the samples table.
SELECT DISTINCT
    time,
    COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS interface_name,
    AVG ( Rx_rate + Tx_rate ) AS "Avg. Rx and Tx"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            host_interface_name AS interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM
            (
                SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent 
                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                        statistics.host_interface_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id = ('$host_id')
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT host_interface_id
                        FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts_interfaces
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.host_interface_id
                        FROM
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        c.host_interface_id = 
                                        b.host_interface_id 
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status 
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_samples
                            ) AS samples_hourly_daily
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        samples_hourly_daily.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime 
                                        AND samples_hourly_daily.host_id = ('$host_id')
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active host only
                            samples_hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            AND c.host_id = ('$host_id')
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                    )
                        GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is up to 24 hours back 
WHERE $__timeFrom() >= (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    interface_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

-- BR2A - This query returns the
-- Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates, over time

-- This query (B) displays historical and recent data 
-- excluding the last few hours, by using the hourly and daily tables.
SELECT DISTINCT
    time,
    COALESCE ( interface_name, MAX ( interface_name ) over ( partition BY 1 ), '' ) AS interface_name,
    AVG ( Rx_rate + Tx_rate ) AS "Avg. Rx and Tx"
FROM 
    (
        SELECT DISTINCT
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            host_interface_name AS interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime AS time,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Rx_rate,
            AVG ( COALESCE ( transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) AS Tx_rate
        FROM
            (
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                UNION
                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent 
                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                    WHERE
                        history_datetime <
                            (
                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                            )
            ) AS statistics
            INNER JOIN 
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces
                ON 
                    (
                        v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id =
                        statistics.host_interface_id
                    )
        WHERE
            -- Here we filter by the host chosen by the user
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_id = ('$host_id')
            -- Here we filter by the time range chosen by the user
            AND history_datetime >= $__timeFrom()
            AND history_datetime < $__timeTo()
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.history_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )
                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS a
                        GROUP BY a.host_interface_id
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT host_interface_id
                        FROM v4_4_latest_configuration_hosts_interfaces
                    )
            AND v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id 
                IN 
                    (
                        SELECT c.host_interface_id
                        FROM
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_interface_id, receive_rate_percent, transmit_rate_percent
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_daily
                                    WHERE
                                        history_datetime <
                                            (
                                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_interfaces_resources_usage_hourly
                                            )
                            ) AS b
                            INNER JOIN 
                            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces c
                                ON 
                                    ( 
                                        c.host_interface_id = 
                                        b.host_interface_id 
                                    )
                            INNER JOIN 
                            (
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status 
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                UNION
                                    SELECT history_datetime, host_id, host_status 
                                    FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_daily
                                    WHERE
                                        history_datetime <
                                            (
                                                SELECT MIN ( history_datetime )
                                                FROM v4_4_statistics_hosts_resources_usage_hourly
                                            )
                            ) AS samples_hourly_daily
                                ON 
                                    (
                                        samples_hourly_daily.history_datetime =
                                        b.history_datetime 
                                        AND samples_hourly_daily.host_id = ('$host_id')
                                    )
                        WHERE
                            -- Here we filter by active host only
                            samples_hourly_daily.host_status = 1
                            AND c.host_id = ('$host_id')
                            AND c.history_id 
                                IN 
                                    (
                                        SELECT MAX ( d.history_id )
                                        FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces AS d
                                        GROUP BY d.host_interface_id
                                    )
                        GROUP BY c.host_interface_id
                        ORDER BY
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.receive_rate_percent, 0 ) ) +
                                AVG ( COALESCE ( b.transmit_rate_percent, 0 ) ) 
                                DESC
                    )
        GROUP BY
            v4_4_configuration_history_hosts_interfaces.host_interface_id,
            interface_name,
            statistics.history_datetime
    ) AS all_sub_queries
-- Show data only when the selected period is more then 24 hours back
WHERE $__timeFrom() < (NOW() - INTERVAL '1443 MINUTES')
GROUP BY 
    all_sub_queries.time, 
    interface_name
ORDER BY all_sub_queries.time ASC

panels.title: Ethernet Interface Tx and Rx Rates (over time) (BR2A)

list.definition:
SELECT DISTINCT   
    CAST ( host_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  
    CASE          
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN host_name 	 	
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN host_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS __text  		
FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts  		
WHERE       		    
    history_id           			    
        IN               				
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.host_id 	         				
            )		
    AND 	    			    
        CASE  	        				    
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					   
                THEN 1=1 		    					
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    
                THEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date ISNULL 	                
        END
list.label: Host
list.name: host_id

    CAST ( host_id AS varchar ) AS __value,  
    CASE          
        WHEN delete_date IS NULL  	     	    
            THEN host_name 	 	
        WHEN delete_date IS NOT null  	      	    
            THEN host_name || ' (Removed on ' || CAST ( CAST ( delete_date AS date ) AS varchar ) || ')'  
    END AS __text  		
FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts  		
WHERE       		    
    history_id           			    
        IN               				
            (  	             					
                SELECT MAX ( a.history_id )  		         					
                FROM v4_4_configuration_history_hosts a  		         					
                GROUP BY a.host_id 	         				
            )		
    AND 	    			    
        CASE  	        				    
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='Yes' 	            					   
                THEN 1=1 		    					
            WHEN '$show_deleted'='No' 		        					    
                THEN v4_4_configuration_history_hosts.delete_date ISNULL 	                
        END
